articles.author: Sam Whitehead
articles.title: Americans With HIV Are Living Longer. Federal Spending Isn’t Keeping Up. - Kaiser Health News
articles.description: Advances in medicine mean more people are living longer with HIV. But aging with HIV comes with an increased risk of health complications, and many worry the U.S. health care system isn’t prepared to treat this growing population.
articles.content: DECATUR, Ga. Malcolm Reid recently marked the anniversary of his HIV diagnosis on Facebook. Diagnosed with HIV 28 years ago, AND TODAY I THRIVE, he wrote in a post in April, which garnered dozens of … [+7546 chars]
